objects.name: Analytic 0435
objects.description: Detection focuses on adversaries placing or modifying malicious dylibs in locations searched by legitimate applications. From the defender’s perspective, observable patterns include unexpected creation or modification of dylib files in application bundle paths, unusual module loads by processes compared to historical baselines, and execution of applications loading dylibs from suspicious directories (e.g., /tmp, user-controlled paths). Correlation across file system changes, process execution, and module loads provides high-fidelity detection.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: macos:unifiedlog
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: process execution events with dylib load activity

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: macos:unifiedlog
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: create/modify dylib files in monitored directories

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Application bundle directories (e.g., /Applications/*/Contents/MacOS, /Library/Frameworks). Adversaries may use non-standard paths like /tmp.
Historical record of dylibs typically loaded by applications. Deviations should be flagged.
Timeframe to correlate dylib file modification with subsequent process execution and module loads.
